ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Through reading different anthropological works on Asian cities, I have learned broader and comparative approach to studying cities. Also in this course I developed different writing skills in writing book reviews, literature reviews and final paper. The careful schedule of professor help us set up our pace on writing and generally structure our research.
I've learned to identify important domains of inquiry in the contemporary studies of Asian cities.
This class provided insight into urban theory, ethnographic research methods, and research products.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Our discussions are inspiring but sometimes I feel like we jump too quickly between topics without digging deep into one topic.

The class was well structured to provide both understanding of class material and foundations for thoughtful discussion. The ethnographies that were covered and weekly book reviews were all strengths of the class. One way to improve the class could be to form reading groups 4-5 students that meet outside of class to discuss the readings. The books were so interesting and sometimes what can be covered in a class meeting was only a fraction of the book.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to another student. The course is well-structured, challenging with proactive thinking.
I would recommend this course to other students interested in urban theory or ethnographic research methods.
